result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Denelius Wayne Heard

defendant.name: Heard, Denelius Wayne
defendant.address: 5230 North Lovers Lane Road, #2, Milwaukee, WI 53225

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Denelius Wayne Heard in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy in court for Denelius Wayne Heard.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact/ No Firearms Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J.M.S.

Defendant Denelius Wayne Heard in court.  Attorney Nicholas John Conrardy appeared by video for Denelius Wayne Heard.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs discovery from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Denelius Wayne Heard in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Pre-trial conference held. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Nicholas Conrardy to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered an Oral No Contact Order with JMS,;
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Denelius Wayne Heard in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Denelius Wayne Heard in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Denelius Wayne Heard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty. DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT.   
This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
